Free-agent guard Seth Curry has agreed to a two-year, $5.6 million deal with the Portland Trail Blazers, league sources told ESPN.

Many of you are asking why the NBA isn't vetoing DeMarcus Cousins to GS. The league can't veto a signing just because a player joins a super-team. The Chris Paul trade veto was an exception - the NBA owned that organization because it was being sold. The NBA can't veto this move.
